description: Evaluation cases for animation studio + Mind latent pipeline.

cases.prompt:
Convert the following brief into strict latent JSON. Return ONLY valid JSON with these exact top-level keys: schema_version, domain, intent, entities, constraints, structure, style, confidence, source. Use schema_version="1.0" and domain="animation". No markdown, no explanations, no code fences.

Example of valid output format:
{"schema_version": "1.0", "domain": "animation", "intent": {"goal": "Create a character asset", "outcome": "Reusable character", "audience": "studio"}, "entities": [{"name": "character_name", "role": "protagonist"}], "constraints": [{"type": "visual", "value": "consistent color palette"}], "structure": {"form": "character design", "sections": ["identity", "personality", "visual"]}, "style": {"tone": "defined", "voice": "character-specific", "length_hint": "concise"}, "confidence": 0.8, "source": {"raw_input": "user brief", "method": "structured parsing"}}

Now encode this brief:
Create Ryxen as a reusable digital actor with consistent silhouette, neon cyan/magenta palette, sarcastic robot-demon personality, and a 4-panel story workflow.

Write a short 4-panel satirical script about Ryxen reacting to a wild market spike. Keep character voice sarcastic but lovable. Output format must be exactly: Panel 1: ..., Panel 2: ..., Panel 3: ..., Panel 4: .... Include Ryxen by name in at least 2 panels.

Generate exactly 6 image prompts for Ryxen with consistent identity: 2 close-ups, 2 full-body, 2 dynamic poses. Output as lines prefixed with CLOSE-UP 1, CLOSE-UP 2, FULL-BODY 1, FULL-BODY 2, DYNAMIC 1, DYNAMIC 2. Then add one line prefixed NEGATIVE PROMPT: ... shared for all.

Create a weekly semi-autonomous production plan for an animation studio that must run while the user is at work. Output sections titled: Schedule, Automation, Approval Gates, Quality Gates, Budget Controls. Keep it concise and operational.
